identificationModule.briefTitle: Role of Left Stellate Ganglion Block in Offering Myocardial Protection in On-pump Mitral Valve Replacement? A Histopathological and Clinical Assessment
identificationModule.officialTitle: Role of Left Stellate Ganglion Block in Offering Myocardial Protection in On-pump Mitral Valve Replacement? A Histopathological and Clinical Assessment

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Can pre-operative left stellate ganglion block offer myocardial protection in on-pump mitral valve replacement? A histopathological and clinical assessment.

armGroups.label: Control group
armGroups.description: Sonar guided stellate ganglion injection of 8 ml of sterile saline 0.9% using high frequency probe as a placebo. Stellate ganglion is identified at the level of C6 just under the pulsation of the ipsilateral carotid artery
interventionNames: Procedure: sonar guided stellate ganglion injection

interventionNames: Procedure: sonar guided stellate ganglion block

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with microscopic myocardial injury
primaryOutcomes.description: Biopsy from left papillary muscle to investigate microscopic evidence of cellular injury ( cytoplasmic oedema, hemorrhage and necrosis).

secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of post operative atrial or ventricular arrhythmia
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: first, second and third day after bypass

secondaryOutcomes.description: Serum troponin I to diagnose myocardial injury
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: before operation, immediately after ICU admission and 3 days post-operative

secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from ICU admission till successful extubation

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adult population of both sex, between 25-50 years, will undergo elective on pump mitral valve replacement

Exclusion Criteria:

* -Combined valve replacement ( mitral and aortic or mitral and tricuspid valves replacement).
* Emergency valve replacement ( stuck valve, infective endocarditis).
* Pre-operative cardiomyopathy (Ejection fraction less than 45%).
* Recent myocardial infarction ( within 6 months)
* Redo mitral valve replacement.
* Pre-operative pacing, or cardioverter, any form arrhythmia ( tachy or brady).
* Previous history of carotid endarterectomy or presence of carotid stent.
* On thrombolytic therapy.
* Severe chronic obstructive airway disease,
* Patient refusal
